verses.text: And the Ziphites came unto Saul to Gibeah , saying , Doth not David hide himself in the hill of Hachilah , \add which is\add* before Jeshimon ?
Then Saul arose , and went down to the wilderness of Ziph , having three thousand chosen men of Israel with him, to seek David in the wilderness of Ziph.
And Saul pitched in the hill of Hachilah , which \add is\add* before Jeshimon , by the way. But David abode in the wilderness , and he saw that Saul came after him into the wilderness.
David therefore sent out spies , and understood that Saul was come in very deed. \p

¶ And David arose , and came to the place where Saul had pitched : and David beheld the place where Saul lay , and Abner the son of Ner , the captain of his host : and Saul lay in the trench , and the people pitched round about him.\f + \fr 26.5 \ft trench: or, midst of his carriages\f* \p

Then answered David and said to Ahimelech the Hittite , and to Abishai the son of Zeruiah , brother to Joab , saying , Who will go down with me to Saul to the camp ? And Abishai said , I will go down with thee.
So David and Abishai came to the people by night : and, behold, Saul lay sleeping within the trench , and his spear stuck in the ground at his bolster : but Abner and the people lay round about him.

Then said Abishai to David , God hath delivered thine enemy into thine hand this day : now therefore let me smite him, I pray thee, with the spear even to the earth at once , and I will not \add smite\add* him the second time.\f + \fr 26.8 \ft delivered: Heb. shut up\f*
And David said to Abishai , Destroy him not: for who can stretch forth his hand against the \nd \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* anointed , and be guiltless ?

David said furthermore, \add As\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* liveth , the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* shall smite him; or his day shall come to die ; or he shall descend into battle , and perish.

The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* forbid that I should stretch forth mine hand against the 
d \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* anointed : but, I pray thee, take thou now the spear that \add is\add* at his bolster , and the cruse of water , and let us go.

So David took the spear and the cruse of water from Saul’s bolster ; and they gat them away , and no man saw \add it\add*, nor knew \add it\add*, neither awaked : for they \add were\add* all asleep ; because a deep sleep from the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* was fallen upon them. \p
¶ Then David went over to the other side , and stood on the top of an hill afar off ; a great space \add being\add* between them:
And David cried to the people , and to Abner the son of Ner , saying , Answerest thou not, Abner ? Then Abner answered and said , Who \add art\add* thou \add that\add* criest to the king ?

And David said to Abner , \add Art\add* not thou a \add valiant\add* man ? and who \add is\add* like to thee in Israel ? wherefore then hast thou not kept thy lord the king ? for there came one of the people in to destroy the king thy lord.

This thing \add is\add* not good that thou hast done. \add As\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* liveth , ye \add are\add* worthy to die , because ye have not kept your master , the 
d \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* anointed. And now see where the king’s spear \add is\add*, and the cruse of water that \add was\add* at his bolster.  +  r 26.16  t worthy to die: Heb. the sons of death *
And Saul knew David’s voice , and said , \add Is\add* this thy voice , my son David ? And David said , \add It is\add* my voice , my lord , O king.
And he said , Wherefore doth my lord thus pursue after his servant ? for what have I done ? or what evil \add is\add* in mine hand ?

Now therefore, I pray thee, let my lord the king hear the words of his servant. If the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* have stirred thee up against me, let him accept an offering : but if \add they be\add* the children of men , cursed \add be\add* they before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; for they have driven me out this day from abiding in the inheritance of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, saying , Go , serve other gods.  +  r 26.19  t accept: Heb. smell *  +  r 26.19  t abiding: Heb. cleaving *

Now therefore, let not my blood fall to the earth before the face of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: for the king of Israel is come out to seek a flea , as when one doth hunt a partridge in the mountains. \p

¶ Then said Saul , I have sinned : return , my son David : for I will no more do thee harm , because my soul was precious in thine eyes this day : behold, I have played the fool , and have erred exceedingly.
And David answered and said , Behold the king’s spear ! and let one of the young men come over and fetch it.

The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* render to every man his righteousness and his faithfulness : for the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* delivered thee into \add my\add* hand to day , but I would not stretch forth mine hand against the 
d \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* anointed.
And, behold, as thy life was much set by this day in mine eyes , so let my life be much set by in the eyes of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and let him deliver me out of all tribulation.
Then Saul said to David , Blessed \add be\add* thou, my son David : thou shalt both do great \add things\add*, and also shalt still prevail. So David went on his way , and Saul returned to his place.
